source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: Diameter histograms of precipitated intermetallic compounds in Zircaloy-4 under representative ∑A observed by means of SEM images magnified to ×10000, Group A specimens.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: Average diameter of intermetallic precipitates ripening with increasing ∑A, Group A specimens.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: The average diameter of an intermetallic compound grew gradually with increasing ΣA up to 200 nm when ΣA was 1.8×10⁻¹⁶

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: Diameter ripening with increasing ∑A, divided into four ranges.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: the diameter distributions of the intermetallic precipitates were divided into four ranges; that is, (a) <100 nm, Range A; (b) 100 to 200 nm, Range B; (c) 200 to 300 nm, Range C; and (d) >300 nm, Range D

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: Above 3×10⁻¹⁷, the curves for Range A and Range C intersected each other.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: The frequency percent in Range B increased once up to 3×10⁻¹⁸ in ΣA and then decreased slightly.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: the weight gain was small when the frequency percent in diameter below 100 nm remained less than ∼30% or the frequency percent above 200 nm exceeded more than ∼25%

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: the fine intermetallic precipitates below 100 nm in diameter influence the uniform corrosion resistance.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: when the frequency in Range C increased above 25%, the weight gain apparently decreased.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: the annealing temperature after the hot rolling influenced the corrosion resistance significantly more than the intermediate annealing temperature during repeated cold rolling.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: Ripening intermetallic precipitates under 100 nm in diameter compared with annealing after hot rolling and cold rolling.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: The frequency percent descended more rapidly, below 30% for the hot-rolling annealing, than for the intermediate annealing.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: The intermetallic particles in the hot-rolling annealing-modified specimens were observed to mainly precipitate at the grain boundaries and grew faster than those precipitated in the grains

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: The oxide scales on the Zircaloy-4, (ΣA = 1.4×10⁻¹⁷) were observed by means of TEM in cross section

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: The intermetallic precipitate incorporated into the ZrO₂ was observed

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: The crystal structure in the middle of the ZrO₂ intermetallic precipitates was analyzed to be the ZrCr₂ hexagonal type

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: The Fe/Cr ratio of the incorporated intermetallic precipitate was reduced to be ∼1, which is much smaller than 2 in the Zircaloy-4 base metal.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: Fe/Cr ratio in the Zircaloy-4 base metal is 2

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk4
evidence_span: The specimen weight gains with different intermediate annealig temperatures after cold rollig increased with the increasin intermetallic particle surface area.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk4
evidence_span: a few recrystallized grains, 100 to $5 0 0 \ \mathrm { n m }$ in diameter, were observed in the higher $\Sigma A$ Zircaloy-4 matrix just beneath the growing front of the oxide.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk4
evidence_span: The recrystallized grains aligned along the interface forming a 600 to 800-nm-wide layer.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk4
evidence_span: FIG. 14—Scale on Zircaloy-4 under $I . 4 \times I O ^ { - 1 7 }$ in ∑A observed by TEM in cross section (673 K, 10.3 MPa, 150 days in steam)

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk4
evidence_span: Uniform corrosion resistance was improved with an increasing cumulative annealing parameter

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk4
evidence_span: the annealing temperature after hot-rolling had greater impact compared to the intermediate annealing and the final annealing temperatures

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk4
evidence_span: When a frequency of the intermetallic compounds under $1 0 0 \mathrm { n m }$ in diameter decreased below $30 \%$ , the corrosion resistance was improved

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk4
evidence_span: frequency of the intermetallic compounds under $1 0 0 \mathrm { n m }$ in diameter decreased below $30 \%$

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk4
evidence_span: primarily iron in the intermetallic precipitates diffused out into the oxide and the $\mathbf { F e / C r }$ ratio of the precipitate changed to ${ \sim } 1$ in the oxide compared to ${ \sim } 2$ in the base metal

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk4
evidence_span: Fe/Cr ratio in base metal was ~2

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk4
evidence_span: the degree of recrystallization in the higher $\Sigma A$ Zircaloy-4 was higher than that in the lower $\Sigma A$ Zircaloy-4

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: In the weight gain-test duration curve of a low corrosion-resistant Zircaloy-4, transition was not obvious after the first transition occurred. However, for a high corrosion-resistant Zircaloy-4, several transitions were apparently observed.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: In the weight gain-test duration curve of a low corrosion-resistant Zircaloy-4, transition was not obvious after the first transition occurred. However, for a high corrosion-resistant Zircaloy-4, several transitions were apparently observed.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: Adjustment of the chemical composition within ASTM limits enables generalized corrosion resistance to be enhanced and irradiation growth to be minimized.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: A significant decrease of the observed scatter in corrosion and mechanical properties is obtained by optimization of the ΣA range, the quenching rate, and the final heat treatment.
property_name: corrosion properties scatter, mechanical properties scatter

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: The optimum seems to be reached for a final treatment at the highest possible temperature compatible with the stress-relieved state, corresponding to an average precipitate size and ΣA.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: Moreover, by adding anneals upstream in the process, a further increase in this ΣA no longer seems to have a significant effect on generalized corrosion.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: Finally, extensive efforts have been employed in the pilgering, surface preparation (outside diameter polishing, flush-pickling), and examination method (UT, EC) leading to a sizable improvement in SCC resistance and to a reduction in scatter for finished tubes.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: The result of these optimizations has been implemented in the current AFA-2G, that shows that under irradiation a 30% corrosion gain is reached after three cycles, without degrading creep strength or growth.
test_type: in-reactor corrosion test, creep test, growth test

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: The intrinsic effect of tin on generalized corrosion resistance under irradiation was also confirmed on this occasion.
